title: Stay Hydrated
summary: Drink plenty of water to stay cool.
content:
Drink at least 8 glasses of water per day.
If you’re out in the sun, carry a water bottle with you.

title: Wear Lightweight Clothing
content:
Choose loose, light-colored, breathable fabrics like cotton.
Hats and sunglasses help protect you from direct sun exposure.

title: Take Frequent Breaks
summary: Rest in the shade if you feel overheated.
content:
When you’re outdoors, rest in the shade every 30–60 minutes.
Listen to your body—if you feel dizzy or fatigued, find a cool place to sit.

title: Avoid Peak Sun Hours
summary: Limit outdoor activities during peak sun hours.
content:
Try to stay indoors between 10 AM and 4 PM when the sun is strongest.
If you must be outside, wear sunscreen with at least SPF 30.

title: Use Sunscreen
content:
Apply a broad-spectrum sunscreen with SPF 30 or higher.
Reapply every two hours, especially after swimming or sweating.
